abstract: Raju Narisetti will become the managing editor of the Wall Street Journal Digital Network, which includes WSJ.com, SmartMoney.com, MarketWatch and the Chinese, Japanese and German-language editions of WSJ.com
snippet: Raju Narisetti will become the managing editor of the Wall Street Journal Digital Network, which includes WSJ.com, SmartMoney.com, MarketWatch and the Chinese, Japanese and German-language editions of WSJ.com
lead_paragraph: The Wall Street Journal has hired Raju Narisetti, a managing editor of The Washington Post, to become managing editor of its online news properties, Dow Jones, the parent company of the Journal, announced on Friday.

headline.main: Washington Post Managing Editor Leaves for The Journal
